title.narrative: Provision of life saving assistance to the conflict affected vulnerable people through treatment of complicated Severe acute malnutrition in Mafa Local government area in Borno state, North east Nigeria

description.narrative:
Plan International Nigeria will implement a 11-month project intervention focusing on strengthening capacity of management of severe acute malnutrition in Stabilization Center (SC), screening and referral of acute malnutrition cases and promoting Optimal IYCF-E in areas were receiving new influx of IDPs and host community in Mafa Local Government Area (LGA). The project plans to provide treatment for a total of 300 SAM children in SC and as well as promoting IYCF-E for SAM care takers/mothers and PLWs. At project start-up, Plan International Nigeria will prioritize access of life-saving services for community mobilization and children under five with complicated SAM cases management in collaboration with state primary health care and development agency and hospital board. We will strengthen capacity of government service providers including community capacity to prevent and respond to the treatment of SAM and as well as prevention of under nutrition and will work closely with communities and partners working the existing camps with the consultation of CCCM sector. Plan International will integrate this project using SPHCDA and hospital staff in the treatment of SAM with medical complication at mafa general hospital with heath care service. The management of children with SAM cases in SC operates from a pick-up truck and compose of government health workers, SC Officer (nurses), SC coordinator (Doctor), SC assistant (nurse) and psychosocial counselling officer who provide a package of services including identification and referral of SAM to the nearest OTP sites, treatment of complicated SAM, psychosocial counselling. The project will strengthen accountability to beneficiaries through the establishment and strengthening of a community based complaints and feedback mechanism that will allow women, girls, men, and boys safely report concerns of the emergency nutrition response in their respective community. Plan International Nigeria is proposing an emergency nutrition response in Mafa LGAs general hospital at Mafa central IDP camp. Thus, the proposed activities will strengthen the management of acute malnutrition through CMAM approach by establishing new SC sites for IDP and provide Optimal IYCF Promotion, providing technical and logistical support, and as well as strengthening the supportive supervision. The project will focus on supporting the most vulnerable population groups, specifically children under five-year age and PLW and other vulnerable group.
In order to address the most urgent needs IDP and host community in the LGAs, Plan international proposes to implement active case finding and referral in reception center for new arrival and, treatment of SAM with medical complication at SC sites with behavioral change on proper nutrition and health and Psychosocial support counselling.
